gwt.g3d.client.math
Class MatrixUtils

java.lang.Object
  gwt.g3d.client.math.MatrixUtils

public class MatrixUtils
extends java.lang.Object

Helper class for manipulating matrix. The matrix libraries such as Matrix3f and Matrix4f are stored in row-major order. However, OpenGL expects column-major matrix by default. Thus, toFloatArray() will return array representation of a matrix in row-major order. To obtain a column-major array representation, using toFloatArrayColMajor().

Author:
hao1300@gmail.com, edwinfsmith@gmail.com

ortho

public static Matrix4f ortho(float left,
                             float right,
                             float bottom,
                             float top,
                             float near,
                             float far)
Outputs a matrix that creates parallel projection.

Parameters:
left - Specify the coordinates for the left vertical clipping planes.
right - Specify the coordinates for the right vertical clipping planes.
bottom - Specify the coordinates for the bottom horizontal clipping planes.
top - Specify the coordinates for the top horizontal clipping planes.
near - Specify the distances to the nearer depth clipping planes. This value is negative if the plane is to be behind the viewer.
far - Specify the distances to the farther depth clipping planes. This value is negative if the plane is to be behind the viewer.

ortho

public static void ortho(float left,
                         float right,
                         float bottom,
                         float top,
                         float near,
                         float far,
                         Matrix4f outMatrix)
Outputs a matrix that creates parallel projection.

Parameters:
left - Specify the coordinates for the left vertical clipping planes.
right - Specify the coordinates for the right vertical clipping planes.
bottom - Specify the coordinates for the bottom horizontal clipping planes.
top - Specify the coordinates for the top horizontal clipping planes.
near - Specify the distances to the nearer depth clipping planes. This value is negative if the plane is to be behind the viewer.
far - Specify the distances to the farther depth clipping planes. This value is negative if the plane is to be behind the viewer.
outMatrix - the matrix to store the parallel projection.

frustum

public static Matrix4f frustum(float left,
                               float right,
                               float bottom,
                               float top,
                               float near,
                               float far)
Creates a perspective matrix that produces a perspective projection.

Parameters:
left - Specify the coordinates for the left vertical clipping planes.
right - Specify the coordinates for the right vertical clipping planes.
bottom - Specify the coordinates for the bottom horizontal clipping planes.
top - Specify the coordinates for the top horizontal clipping planes.
near - Specify the distances to the nearer depth clipping planes. Must be positive.
far - Specify the distances to the farther depth clipping planes. Must be positive.

frustum

public static void frustum(float left,
                           float right,
                           float bottom,
                           float top,
                           float near,
                           float far,
                           Matrix4f outMatrix)
Creates a perspective matrix that produces a perspective projection.

Parameters:
left - Specify the coordinates for the left vertical clipping planes.
right - Specify the coordinates for the right vertical clipping planes.
bottom - Specify the coordinates for the bottom horizontal clipping planes.
top - Specify the coordinates for the top horizontal clipping planes.
near - Specify the distances to the nearer depth clipping planes. Must be positive.
far - Specify the distances to the farther depth clipping planes. Must be positive.
outMatrix - the matrix to store the perspective projection.

perspective

public static Matrix4f perspective(float fovy,
                                   float aspect,
                                   float zNear,
                                   float zFar)
Sets up a perspective projection matrix.

Parameters:
fovy - Specifies the field of view angle, in degrees, in the y direction.
aspect - Specifies the aspect ratio that determines the field of view in the x direction. The aspect ratio is the ratio of x (width) to y (height).
zNear - Specifies the distance from the viewer to the near clipping plane (always positive).
zFar - Specifies the distance from the viewer to the far clipping plane (always positive).

perspective

public static void perspective(float fovy,
                               float aspect,
                               float zNear,
                               float zFar,
                               Matrix4f outMatrix)
Sets up a perspective projection matrix.

Parameters:
fovy - Specifies the field of view angle, in degrees, in the y direction.
aspect - Specifies the aspect ratio that determines the field of view in the x direction. The aspect ratio is the ratio of x (width) to y (height).
zNear - Specifies the distance from the viewer to the near clipping plane (always positive).
zFar - Specifies the distance from the viewer to the far clipping plane (always positive).
outMatrix - the matrix to store the perspective transformation.

lookAt

public static Matrix4f lookAt(float eyex,
                              float eyey,
                              float eyez,
                              float centerx,
                              float centery,
                              float centerz,
                              float upx,
                              float upy,
                              float upz)
Sets up a matrix that defines a viewing transformation.

Parameters:
eyex - Specifies the x position of the eye point.
eyey - Specifies the y position of the eye point.
eyez - Specifies the z position of the eye point.
centerx - Specifies the x position of the reference point.
centery - Specifies the y position of the reference point.
centerz - Specifies the z position of the reference point.
upx - Specifies the direction of the up vector.
upy - Specifies the direction of the up vector.
upz - Specifies the direction of the up vector.

lookAt

public static void lookAt(float eyex,
                          float eyey,
                          float eyez,
                          float centerx,
                          float centery,
                          float centerz,
                          float upx,
                          float upy,
                          float upz,
                          Matrix4f outMatrix)
Sets up a matrix that defines a viewing transformation.

Parameters:
eyex - Specifies the x position of the eye point.
eyey - Specifies the y position of the eye point.
eyez - Specifies the z position of the eye point.
centerx - Specifies the x position of the reference point.
centery - Specifies the y position of the reference point.
centerz - Specifies the z position of the reference point.
upx - Specifies the direction of the up vector.
upy - Specifies the direction of the up vector.
upz - Specifies the direction of the up vector.
outMatrix - the matrix to store the look at transformation.

unproject

public static Vector3f unproject(Vector3f winPos,
                                 Matrix4f model,
                                 Matrix4f proj,
                                 Rectangle viewport)
Transforms input point from screen space to world space.

Parameters:
winPos - Specify the window coordinates to be mapped.
model - Specifies the modelview matrix
proj - Specifies the projection matrix
viewport - Specifies the viewport
Returns:
Returns the computed object coordinates
